iot_net_planner

Geo

  • The key abstract class is LinkSampler, which represents a terrain data structure that can be sampled. The primary implemtation is DSMSampler, which represents real terrain data.

  • This submodule also contains classes for interpolating a DSM, estimating potential gateway locations, and plotting gateways.

A module for creating a grid of demand points over an area file

iot_net_planner.geo.demand_grid.add_alts(dems: GeoDataFrame, sampler) → GeoDataFrame

Add altitudes to a demand GeoDataFrame

Parameters:

  • dems (geopandas.GeoDataFrame) – the GeoDataFrame to add altitudes to, may be modified in place

  • sampler (class: iot_net_planner.geo.sampler.Sampler) – the sampler to use to determine the altitudes

Returns:

the modified GeoDataFrame

Return type:

geopandas.GeoDataFrame

iot_net_planner.geo.demand_grid.generate_grid(area_file: str, granularity: float, sampler=None, utm=None) → GeoDataFrame

Generates a grid of demand points in the area defined by area_file with the number of points determined by granularity

Parameters:

  • area_file (str) – a path to a kml file representing the area to put demand points

  • granularity (float) – one point will be placed every granularity units, where units are the distance in the area_file’s crs or supplied utm

  • sampler (class: iot_net_planner.geo.sampler.Sampler, optional) – a geo sampler to use to fill the altitude column. If None there will be no altitude column, defaults to None

  • utm (str, optional) – a crs for the area. If None then the area_file’s crs is used, which may mean that granularity will be strange units, defaults to None

Returns:

a GeoDataFrame of the demand points

Return type:

geopandas.GeoDataFrame

iot_net_planner.geo.demand_grid.generate_grid_with_points(area_file, target_points, sampler=None, utm=None)

Tries to generate a grid of demand points with roughly target_points demand points the answer may not be exact

Parameters:

  • area_file (str) – a path to a kml file representing the area to put demand points

  • target_points (int) – the target number of demand points, may not be exact

  • sampler (class: iot_net_planner.geo.sampler.Sampler, optional) – a geo sampler to use to fill the altitude column. If None there will be no altitude column, defaults to None.

  • utm (str, optional) – a crs for the area. If None then the area_file’s crs is used, which may mean that granularity will no longer be meters, defaults to None.

Returns:

a GeoDataFrame of the demand points

Return type:

geopandas.GeoDataFrame

iot_net_planner.geo.demand_grid.load_file(area_file: str, utm=None) → GeoDataFrame

Load all layers of a KML file into a GeoDataFrame

Parameters:

  • area_file (str) – a path to the KML file

  • utm (str, optional) – a crs to convert the resulting dataframe to. When None the area_file’s crs is used, defaults to None

Returns:

the loaded GeoDataFrame

Return type:

geopandas.GeoDataFrame

A tool for filling holes in a DSM using interpolation

iot_net_planner.geo.dsm_filler.fill_file(input_file, output_file, band, threshold=-9000)

Interpolate a DSM file to fill in holes

Parameters:

  • input_file (str) – a path to the DSM

  • output_file (str) – the path to save the modified DSM

  • band (int) – the 1-indexed band number to modify from the DSM

  • threshold (int, optional) – values below this threshold will be interpolated, defaults to -9000

class iot_net_planner.geo.dsm_sampler.DSMSampler(crs, raster_path, band=None)

A link sampler that samples from a DSM. All DSM samplers should be cleaned up after use using self.clean_up(). Conversely, you can use the `with open DSMSampler(crs, path) as sampler` syntax.

Parameters:

  • crs (str) – the crs of the input points, should match the demand and facility crs.

  • raster_path (str) – a path to the raster file to use.

  • band (int, optional) – the 0-indexed DSM band to use, can be None if only one band is present, defaults to None.

batched_sample(xs, ys)

Return a numpy array of the samples at the points defined by xs and ys

Parameters:

  • xs (np.ndarray) – the x-coordinates in the provided crs

  • ys (np.ndarray) – the y-coordinates in the provided crs with len(ys) == len(xs)

Returns:

the samples at the provided points

Return type:

np.ndarray

clean_up()

Closes the raster file, should always be called after the sampler is no longer in use

sample(x, y)

Return the raster sample at x, y

Parameters:

  • x (float) – the x-coordinate in the provided crs

  • y (float) – the y-coordinate in the provided crs

Returns:

the sample at (x, y)

Return type:

float

Provides a function for guessing some good potential gateway locations based on building corners

iot_net_planner.geo.estimate_facs.generate_facs(area, n_facs=None, sampler=None)

Estimate potential gateway locations for an area. Estimated locations will be the corners of buildings.

Parameters:

  • area (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a loaded KML area loaded with geo.demand_grid.load_file

  • n_facs (int, optional) – the target number of potential gateway locations to find. If it can’t find enough it will return as many as it finds. If None, returns all found facs, defaults to None.

  • sampler (class: iot_net_planner.geo.sampler.LinkSampler, optional) – if a sampler is provided then it will be used to fill the altitude column. Must be initialized with area’s crs. If None, no altitude is given, defaults to None

Tools for plotting coverage. This module does not compute coverage, it only displays it

iot_net_planner.geo.plotting.plot_demands(dems)

Creates and shows a matplotlib plot showing the demand points in dems

Parameters:

dems (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the demand points to show in the plot

iot_net_planner.geo.plotting.plot_fac_coverage(dems, facs, fac, contributions)

Creates and shows a matplotlib plot showing the coverage from fac to all of dems

Parameters:

  • dems (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the demand points to show coverage of

  • facs (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the facility points to show covverage from

  • fac (int) – the index into facs representing the facility point to graph

  • contributions (np.ndarray) – a numpy array of the contributions to each of the demand points with len(contributions) == len(dems). Look into predictions.prr_model for generating predictions

iot_net_planner.geo.plotting.plot_facs(facs)

Creates and shows a matplotlib plot showing the facility points in facs

Parameters:

facs (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the facility points to show in the plot

iot_net_planner.geo.plotting.plot_facs_coverage(dems, facs, built, contributions)

Creates and shows a matplotlib plot showing the coverage from fac to all of dems

Parameters:

  • dems (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the demand points to show coverage of

  • facs (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – a GeoDataFrame of the facility points to show covverage from

  • built (list) – a list of the indices into facs representing the facility points to graph

  • contributions (np.ndarray) – a numpy array of the contributions to each of the demand points with len(contributions) == len(dems). Look into predictions.prr_model for generating predictions

Defines an abstract class for a terrain sampler.

class iot_net_planner.geo.sampler.LinkSampler

An abstract base class for a terrain sampler. Terrain samplers support giving the terrain height at certain locations on a texture. Implementing classes include geo.dsm_sampler for sampling real geodata or geo.simplex_sampler for sampling random terrain

abstract batched_sample(xs, ys)

Return a numpy array of the samples at the points defined by xs and ys

Parameters:

  • xs (np.ndarray) – the x-coordinates in the provided crs

  • ys (np.ndarray) – the y-coordinates in the provided crs with len(ys) == len(xs)

Returns:

the samples at the provided points

Return type:

np.ndarray

abstract sample(x, y)

Return the raster sample at x, y

Parameters:

  • x (float) – the x-coordinate in the provided crs

  • y (float) – the y-coordinate in the provided crs

Returns:

the sample at (x, y)

Return type:

float

A tool for sampling simulated random terrain

class iot_net_planner.geo.simplex_sampler.SimplexSampler(random_seed, scale=1.0)

A sampler that samples from a random texture to simulate a random terrain

Parameters:

  • random_seed (int) – the seed for the random texture

  • scale (float, optional) – a float greater than 0 controlling the size of the noise. A smaller number means the terrain will be generally more uniform, defaults to 1.0.

batched_sample(xs, ys)

Return a numpy array of the samples at the points defined by xs and ys

Parameters:

  • xs (np.ndarray) – the x-coordinates in the provided crs

  • ys (np.ndarray) – the y-coordinates in the provided crs with len(ys) == len(xs)

Returns:

the samples at the provided points

Return type:

np.ndarray

Return the raster sample at x, y

Parameters:

  • y (float) – the y-coordinate in the provided crs

Returns:

the sample at (x, y)
